description:
The main character, Endou Mamoru, is a very talented goalkeeper and the grandson of one of the strongest goalkeepers in Japan, who died before he was born. Even though his skills are incredible his school lacks a real soccer club as the 6 other members don't appear very interested even in training. But as soon as a mysterious forward called Gouenji moves to Endou's town, the young goalkeeper sets out to find and recruit members for his soccer team.

(Source: Wikipedia)

tags.name: Football
tags.description: Centers around the sport of football (known in the USA as "soccer").

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

node.description: __Berryz Kobo__ (Berryz工房?, literally "Berryz Workshop"; sometimes romanized as Berryz Koubou or Berryz Kōbō) is an all-girl J-pop group within Hello! Project.  Its members are Shimizu Saki (captain), Natsuyaki Miyabi, Sugaya Risako, Tsugunaga Momoko, Kumai Yurina, Sudo Maasa and Tokunaga Chinami.  Ishimura Maiha, a former member, graduated in October 2005 to continue her schooling full-time.

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/秋山勝仁)

Acknowledged for his work in the [Inazuma Eleven](https://anilist.co/anime/5231/) franchise and numerous [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/) shows in the '90s.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YasunoriMitsuda) | [Profile](https://www.procyon-studio.co.jp/staff/mitsuda/) | [Blog](https://www.procyon-studio.com/blog/)

Yasunori Mitsuda is a Japanese composer and musician. He is best known for his work in video games, primarily for the Chrono, Shadow Hearts, and Inazuma Eleven franchises, among various others. Mitsuda began composing music for his own games in high school, later attending the Junior College of Music in Tokyo. While still a student, he was granted an intern position at the game development studio Wolf Team.

Mitsuda later joined Square Co., Ltd.(now Square Enix) upon graduation in 1992 after seeing a magazine advertisement in an office he was visiting with his professor. He worked there as a sound effects designer for two years before telling Square's vice president [Hironobu Sakaguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/101047/Hironobu-Sakaguchi) he would quit unless he could write music for their games. Shortly after, Sakaguchi assigned him to work on the soundtrack for Chrono Trigger, whose music has since been cited as among the best in video games.

After Chrono Trigger's success and the music's acclaim. Mitsuda went on to compose for several other games at Square, including Xenogears (1998) and Chrono Cross (1999). He left the company and became independent in 1998.

In 2001, he respectively founded his own music production studio and record company, Procyon Studio and Sleigh Bells. Mitsuda has also contributed music for anime series, films, and television programs, as well as producing albums.

__Graduated:__ Tokyo Zokei University

Takizawa Toshifumi was a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

After he graduated Tokyo Zokei University, he got to work at Tokyo Animation Film, where he worked as part of a photography team. In later years he started working for Shin-Ei Douga, where he was a production assistant. After he started working at Nippon Sunrise, he became a director, giving his debut in 1985 with the Dirty Pair TV series. He continued working as a director afterwards, but as a freelancer instead.

He was a line director on the Ideon Be Invoked film, he was also involved in the Votoms series and has directed Gonzo's TV adaption of Kurosawa's epic Samurai 7 film, which he did in 2004.

Toshifumi passed away on June 22, 2015 from esophageal cancer. He was 61 years old when he died, and up until that point he would still be doing his ordinary activities like driving his car and walking his dog.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/AkihiroHino)

A video game designer. Started his career as a programmer in the late '80s, and later took on roles in writing, designing, directing and producing. In 1998, he founded Level-5, a Japanese video game studio, where he remains its president and CEO.

Known for titles such as Dark Cloud, Dark Chronicle, Inazuma Eleven and Professor Layton.
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/naganotakuzo)

name.native: ティーピストンズプラスケムシ

node.description:
[Blog](https://ameblo.jp/t-pistonz/)

A Japanese pop group under the "FRAME" label; a joint venture of Level-5, currently with Avex Group and formerly with the Up-Front Group.

They actually debuted on UFG imprint "hachama".  

Current squad: 

- Ton-Nino (Lead vocalist) Elder brother of Hiroshi Dot. 
- KMC (Rapper) - In-Chiquita (Dancer and Choreographer) 
- Hiroshi Dot (Side Vocalist and Dancer) Younger brother of Ton-Nino.
